intro: Cenchrus gracillimus, commonly known as slender panicgrass, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Cenchrus gracillimus is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
